text:
hi guys welcome to Pai's Thailand food blog where 
I show you the everyday Thai food culture through

just the stuff that I'm eating on a regular 
basis so today I am outside of Bangkok but just

outside in the province of ayutthaya if you've 
been here you may have been here it's a pretty

popular touristy space my cousin happens to be 
a local here so she's taking us around the city

so there's the cousin so when you come to a UTI 
there are a couple of must-have food items and one

of the things is boat noodles now I'm not sure if 
it's originated from here but it is everywhere in

a UTI so we're here at a place next to a temple 
called what the H I am on Conan so there's this

nice place that you can sit in have some boat 
noodles now what is boat noodles I have done

a thing on boat noodles in my last video about 
the top 5 noodle soup roundup so you can take a

look at that if you want to know more about it 
but just roughly it's these noodles with this

really flavorful broth that's flavored with soy 
sauce and a lot of different spices like cinnamon

and sarnies and there's also some fresh blood 
in here that gives it that nice thick rich body

sorry it's like half-eaten because we forgot that 
we were supposed to build this and then a lot of

times they'll serve it with some chicharrones or 
crispy fried pork skin but you also find that a

lot of bone Udo's places we'll have dessert on 
the table for you to grab whenever you're done

with your meal and these are these couple well 
what I'm gonna call cupcakes but they're called

kinome TOI in Thai and it's basically a rice cake 
with a coconut quote-unquote frosting and it's

just in here and when you're done you just eat it 
and they'll come and check how many you've eaten

and they'll charge you accordingly so that's kind 
of a cool little system there and that is it for

our lunch we will keep you posted on what we go 
and eat mix in a UTM so we are stopping because

it's so hot at the water market in AU yeah and so 
Bywater market I don't mean like floating market

where you go sit in a boat meaning the water the 
market is on the water water is right beside me

over here but you don't physically have to get 
into a boat to get anything so we got some cooling

desert because it's 41 degrees Celsius and this 
is called council cup I literally volcano bread

and it's this brown stuff is Milo or Ovaltine 
either one and it's like a chocolate malt drink

powder and they're shaved ice underneath here 
with condensed milk and whatnot and there's cubes

of bread buried under here and the bread is just 
soaking you know condensed milk and Milo and all

this stuff this low volcano thing is becoming 
a thing like a trendy new thing so originally

the volcano thing is a drink where they pile 
a bunch of Milo powder on top of a drink but

it's the volcano concept is seeping into other 
desserts as well so here we go to cool it down

so we left the heat of the floating market 
- and now we're having a second lunch it's

2 o'clock it's our second lunch of the day and 
we're at sort of the local Thai restaurant that

specializes in things that are shrimpy because 
in a UTI they are famous for their River prawns

because it's surrounded by rivers so so far we've 
got a few things on the table we've got this one

right here which is kind of their specialty it's 
a stir-fry with curry paste and I believe it's the

cartilage and some bits of pork and so the way 
you eat this is you've got these leaves which

are they're a kind of herb that smells very much 
like holy basil and then you make a little cup

out of it you add a little bit of this spicy stuff 
and then you add one of these which is a pickled

garlic so it's a type of garlic that comes in 
a single clove and then you add kind of like

pearl onions and then you add to it and then 
you know this is one bite and then right next

to that if that's something that's interesting 
I wanted to show you which is a surf write of

shrimp dry squid which is this thing right here 
and these things are the stems of lotus flowers

and it's it's got a really mild flavor but a nice 
crunchy texture and it's great in stir fries or we

also use it in curries and soups and whatnot 
and then this over here or what's less of it

is a salad so it's a kind of a YUM of the stuff 
in the shrimp heads so it's called tamale so if

you know big shrimp got lots and lots of Somali 
and it's basically the liver which is very very

fatty and they take it cook it and then turn it 
into a salad and so that's what we've got so far

and finally the highlights of a UTA this is 
that must not miss item is roti saimai or

this thin crepe with pulled sugar so this is 
sure that's been pulled and pulled and pulled

until it's become like a silk strand and 
then you make like a little burrito out of

it so this place is apparently the most famous 
place in the UK yeah there's always a line but

you can find these everywhere but apparently 
this is the best one and then you roll it like

a burrito and then if it's good the the crepe 
should be very thin and and soft and it's got

like a really nice pandan flavor and the sugar 
should be nice and and crunchy and still fresh
